summary: The Congressional Award Foundation is a privately-funded charity established by Congress to recognize our nation’s youth for voluntary public service, personal development, physical fitness, and expedition or exploration. The Foundation is required to have its financial statements audited annually, and we're required to review those audits. The Foundation's auditor issued an unmodified (clean) opinion on its fiscal year 2018 financial statements, concluding that these fairly...
title: Congressional Award Foundation: Review of the Audit of the Financial Statements for Fiscal Year 2018
